text: Izta-Popo Zoquiapan National Park is a national park in Mexico on the border of the states of México, Puebla, and Morelos. The park protects , surrounding Mexico's second- and third-highest peaks, the Popocatépetl and Iztaccíhuatl volcanoes (respectively and ) as well as the area of the Hacienda de Zoquiapán, and its annexed areas (anexas) of Zoquiapan, Ixtlahuacán, and the Frío de Juárez River. ==History== Animation about the park created by the Pro Natura organization The park was established on November 8, 1935, and today is administered by the National Commission of Protected Natural Areas (CONANP), a federal agency of the Secretariat of Environment and Natural Resources. ==See also== * Popocatépetl and Iztaccíhuatl ==Notelist== ==References== ==Further reading== *Web site at CONANP (Spanish) Category:National parks of Mexico Category:Protected areas of the State of Mexico Category:Protected areas of Morelos Category:Protected areas of Puebla Category:Protected areas established in 1935 Category:1935 establishments in Mexico Category:Natural history of the State of Mexico Category:Natural history of Morelos Category:Natural history of Puebla Category:Trans-Mexican Volcanic Belt
title: Izta-Popo Zoquiapan National Park
